cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi E of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 135 mi SE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north Tuesday, then drift slowly north-northeast and curve across Alabama and Georgia before reaching the western Carolinas and the Atlantic coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Alabama–Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Morgan City LA to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Watch: east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL; Storm-surge Watch: Port Fourchon LA to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City LA to Navarre FL (incl. New Orleans area); Tropical Storm Warning: east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL; Storm-surge Warning: Port Fourchon LA to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL, incl. Mobile Bay and Lakes Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (southeast LA through western FL Panhandle) with inland impacts spreading across AL, GA, and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late Thursday into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected (surge heights likely below 3 ft along the South Carolina coast)
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher amounts as the remnant core moves over or near the port, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and river/urban flooding as the system passes inland
